measure.name: build_residential_hpxml
measure.modeler_description: Note: OS-HPXML default values can be found in the OS-HPXML documentation or can be seen by using the 'apply_defaults' argument.

argument.name: hpxml_path
argument.description: Absolute/relative path of the HPXML file.

argument.name: software_info_program_used
argument.description: The name of the software program used.

argument.name: software_info_program_version
argument.description: The version of the software program used.

argument.name: occupancy_calculation_type
argument.description: The type of occupancy calculation type. If 'asset' is chosen, various end uses (e.g., clothes washer) are calculated using number of bedrooms and/or conditioned floor area. If 'operational' is chosen, end uses based on number of bedrooms are adjusted for the number of occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: schedules_filepaths
argument.description: Absolute/relative paths of csv files containing user-specified detailed schedules. If multiple files, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: simulation_control_timestep
argument.description: Value must be a divisor of 60. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_run_period
argument.description: Enter a date like "Jan 1 - Dec 31". If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_run_period_calendar_year
argument.display_name: Simulation Control: Run Period Calendar Year
argument.description: This numeric field should contain the calendar year that determines the start day of week. If you are running simulations using AMY weather files, the value entered for calendar year will not be used; it will be overridden by the actual year found in the AMY weather file. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_daylight_saving_enabled
argument.description: Whether to use daylight saving. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_daylight_saving_period
argument.description: Enter a date like "Mar 15 - Dec 15". If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_temperature_capacitance_multiplier
argument.description: Affects the transient calculation of indoor air temperatures. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: site_type
argument.description: The type of site. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: site_shielding_of_home
argument.description: Presence of nearby buildings, trees, obstructions for infiltration model. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: site_ground_conductivity
argument.description: Conductivity of the ground soil. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: site_zip_code
argument.description: Zip code of the home address.

argument.name: site_iecc_zone
argument.description: IECC zone of the home address.

argument.name: site_state_code
argument.description: State code of the home address.

argument.name: site_time_zone_utc_offset
argument.description: Time zone UTC offset of the home address. Must be between -12 and 14.

argument.name: weather_station_epw_filepath
argument.description: Path of the EPW file.

argument.name: year_built
argument.description: The year the building was built.

argument.name: geometry_unit_type
argument.description: The type of dwelling unit. Use single-family attached for a dwelling unit with 1 or more stories, attached units to one or both sides, and no units above/below. Use apartment unit for a dwelling unit with 1 story, attached units to one, two, or three sides, and units above and/or below.

argument.name: geometry_unit_left_wall_is_adiabatic
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Left Wall Is Adiabatic
argument.description: Presence of an adiabatic left wall.

argument.name: geometry_unit_right_wall_is_adiabatic
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Right Wall Is Adiabatic
argument.description: Presence of an adiabatic right wall.

argument.name: geometry_unit_front_wall_is_adiabatic
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Front Wall Is Adiabatic
argument.description: Presence of an adiabatic front wall, for example, the unit is adjacent to a conditioned corridor.

argument.name: geometry_unit_back_wall_is_adiabatic
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Back Wall Is Adiabatic
argument.description: Presence of an adiabatic back wall.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_floors_above_grade
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Number of Floors Above Grade
argument.description: The number of floors above grade in the unit. Attic type ConditionedAttic is included. Assumed to be 1 for apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_unit_cfa
argument.description: The total floor area of the unit's conditioned space (including any conditioned basement floor area).

argument.name: geometry_unit_aspect_ratio
argument.description: The ratio of front/back wall length to left/right wall length for the unit, excluding any protruding garage wall area.

argument.name: geometry_unit_orientation
argument.description: The unit's orientation is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bedrooms
argument.description: The number of bedrooms in the unit. Used to determine the energy usage of appliances and plug loads, hot water usage, etc.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bathrooms
argument.description: The number of bathrooms in the unit. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_occupants
argument.description: The number of occupants in the unit. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used. Required if Occupancy Calculation Type is 'operational'.

argument.name: geometry_building_num_units
argument.description: The number of units in the building. Required for single-family attached and apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_average_ceiling_height
argument.description: Average distance from the floor to the ceiling.

argument.name: geometry_garage_width
argument.description: The width of the garage. Enter zero for no garage. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_garage_depth
argument.description: The depth of the garage. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_garage_protrusion
argument.description: The fraction of the garage that is protruding from the living space. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_garage_position
argument.description: The position of the garage. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_foundation_type
argument.description: The foundation type of the building. Foundation types ConditionedBasement and ConditionedCrawlspace are not allowed for apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_foundation_height
argument.description: The height of the foundation (e.g., 3ft for crawlspace, 8ft for basement). Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: geometry_foundation_height_above_grade
argument.description: The depth above grade of the foundation wall. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: geometry_rim_joist_height
argument.description: The height of the rim joists. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: geometry_attic_type
argument.description: The attic type of the building. Attic type ConditionedAttic is not allowed for apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_roof_type
argument.description: The roof type of the building. Ignored if the building has a flat roof.

argument.name: geometry_roof_pitch
argument.description: The roof pitch of the attic. Ignored if the building has a flat roof.

argument.name: geometry_eaves_depth
argument.description: The eaves depth of the roof.

argument.name: geometry_has_flue_or_chimney
argument.description: Presence of flue or chimney for infiltration model. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: neighbor_front_distance
argument.description: The distance between the unit and the neighboring building to the front (not including eaves). A value of zero indicates no neighbors. Used for shading.

argument.name: neighbor_back_distance
argument.description: The distance between the unit and the neighboring building to the back (not including eaves). A value of zero indicates no neighbors. Used for shading.

argument.name: neighbor_left_distance
argument.description: The distance between the unit and the neighboring building to the left (not including eaves). A value of zero indicates no neighbors. Used for shading.

argument.name: neighbor_right_distance
argument.description: The distance between the unit and the neighboring building to the right (not including eaves). A value of zero indicates no neighbors. Used for shading.

argument.name: neighbor_front_height
argument.description: The height of the neighboring building to the front. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: neighbor_back_height
argument.description: The height of the neighboring building to the back. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: neighbor_left_height
argument.description: The height of the neighboring building to the left. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: neighbor_right_height
argument.description: The height of the neighboring building to the right. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: floor_over_foundation_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the floor over the foundation. Ignored if the building has a slab-on-grade foundation.

argument.name: floor_over_garage_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the floor over the garage. Ignored unless the building has a garage under conditioned space.

argument.name: floor_type
argument.description: The type of floors.

argument.name: foundation_wall_type
argument.description: The material type of the foundation wall. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: foundation_wall_thickness
argument.description: The thickness of the foundation wall. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: foundation_wall_insulation_r
argument.description: Nominal R-value for the foundation wall insulation. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: foundation_wall_insulation_location
argument.description: Whether the insulation is on the interior or exterior of the foundation wall. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: foundation_wall_insulation_distance_to_top
argument.display_name: Foundation Wall: Insulation Distance To Top
argument.description: The distance from the top of the foundation wall to the top of the foundation wall insulation. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: foundation_wall_insulation_distance_to_bottom
argument.display_name: Foundation Wall: Insulation Distance To Bottom
argument.description: The distance from the top of the foundation wall to the bottom of the foundation wall insulation. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: foundation_wall_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the foundation walls. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces. If provided, overrides the previous foundation wall insulation inputs. If not provided, it is ignored.

argument.name: rim_joist_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the rim joists. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces. Required if a rim joist height is provided.

argument.name: slab_perimeter_insulation_r
argument.description: Nominal R-value of the vertical slab perimeter insulation. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_perimeter_depth
argument.description: Depth from grade to bottom of vertical slab perimeter insulation. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_under_insulation_r
argument.display_name: Slab: Under Slab Insulation Nominal R-value
argument.description: Nominal R-value of the horizontal under slab insulation. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_under_width
argument.description: Width from slab edge inward of horizontal under-slab insulation. Enter 999 to specify that the under slab insulation spans the entire slab. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_thickness
argument.description: The thickness of the slab. Zero can be entered if there is a dirt floor instead of a slab. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: slab_carpet_fraction
argument.description: Fraction of the slab floor area that is carpeted. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: slab_carpet_r
argument.description: R-value of the slab carpet. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: ceiling_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the ceiling (attic floor).

argument.name: roof_material_type
argument.description: The material type of the roof. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: roof_color
argument.description: The color of the roof. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: roof_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value of the roof.

argument.name: roof_radiant_barrier
argument.description: Presence of a radiant barrier in the attic.

argument.name: roof_radiant_barrier_grade
argument.description: The grade of the radiant barrier, if it exists.

argument.name: wall_type
argument.description: The type of walls.

argument.name: wall_siding_type
argument.description: The siding type of the walls. Also applies to rim joists. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: wall_color
argument.description: The color of the walls. Also applies to rim joists. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: wall_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value of the walls.

argument.name: window_front_wwr
argument.description: The ratio of window area to wall area for the unit's front facade. Enter 0 if specifying Front Window Area instead.

argument.name: window_back_wwr
argument.description: The ratio of window area to wall area for the unit's back facade. Enter 0 if specifying Back Window Area instead.

argument.name: window_left_wwr
argument.description: The ratio of window area to wall area for the unit's left facade (when viewed from the front). Enter 0 if specifying Left Window Area instead.

argument.name: window_right_wwr
argument.description: The ratio of window area to wall area for the unit's right facade (when viewed from the front). Enter 0 if specifying Right Window Area instead.

argument.name: window_area_front
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's front facade. Enter 0 if specifying Front Window-to-Wall Ratio instead.

argument.name: window_area_back
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's back facade. Enter 0 if specifying Back Window-to-Wall Ratio instead.

argument.name: window_area_left
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's left facade (when viewed from the front). Enter 0 if specifying Left Window-to-Wall Ratio instead.

argument.name: window_area_right
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's right facade (when viewed from the front). Enter 0 if specifying Right Window-to-Wall Ratio instead.

argument.name: window_aspect_ratio
argument.description: Ratio of window height to width.

argument.name: window_fraction_operable
argument.description: Fraction of windows that are operable. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: window_natvent_availability
argument.description: For operable windows, the number of days/week that windows can be opened by occupants for natural ventilation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: window_ufactor
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC U-factor.

argument.name: window_shgc
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC solar heat gain coefficient.

argument.name: window_interior_shading_winter
argument.description: Interior shading multiplier for the heating season. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: window_interior_shading_summer
argument.description: Interior shading multiplier for the cooling season. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: window_exterior_shading_winter
argument.description: Exterior shading multiplier for the heating season. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: window_exterior_shading_summer
argument.description: Exterior shading multiplier for the cooling season. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: window_storm_type
argument.description: The type of storm, if present. If not provided, assumes there is no storm.

argument.name: overhangs_front_depth
argument.description: The depth of overhangs for windows for the front facade.

argument.name: overhangs_front_distance_to_top_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Front Distance to Top of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the top of window for the front facade.

argument.name: overhangs_front_distance_to_bottom_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Front Distance to Bottom of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the bottom of window for the front facade.

argument.name: overhangs_back_depth
argument.description: The depth of overhangs for windows for the back facade.

argument.name: overhangs_back_distance_to_top_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Back Distance to Top of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the top of window for the back facade.

argument.name: overhangs_back_distance_to_bottom_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Back Distance to Bottom of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the bottom of window for the back facade.

argument.name: overhangs_left_depth
argument.description: The depth of overhangs for windows for the left facade.

argument.name: overhangs_left_distance_to_top_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Left Distance to Top of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the top of window for the left facade.

argument.name: overhangs_left_distance_to_bottom_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Left Distance to Bottom of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the bottom of window for the left facade.

argument.name: overhangs_right_depth
argument.description: The depth of overhangs for windows for the right facade.

argument.name: overhangs_right_distance_to_top_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Right Distance to Top of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the top of window for the right facade.

argument.name: overhangs_right_distance_to_bottom_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Right Distance to Bottom of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the bottom of window for the right facade.

argument.name: skylight_area_front
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's front conditioned roof facade.

argument.name: skylight_area_back
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's back conditioned roof facade.

argument.name: skylight_area_left
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's left conditioned roof facade (when viewed from the front).

argument.name: skylight_area_right
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's right conditioned roof facade (when viewed from the front).

argument.name: skylight_ufactor
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC U-factor.

argument.name: skylight_shgc
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC solar heat gain coefficient.

argument.name: skylight_storm_type
argument.description: The type of storm, if present. If not provided, assumes there is no storm.

argument.name: door_area
argument.description: The area of the opaque door(s).

argument.name: door_rvalue
argument.description: R-value of the opaque door(s).

argument.name: air_leakage_units
argument.description: The unit of measure for the air leakage.

argument.name: air_leakage_house_pressure
argument.description: The house pressure relative to outside. Required when units are ACH or CFM.

argument.name: air_leakage_value
argument.description: Air exchange rate value.

argument.name: heating_system_type
argument.description: The type of heating system. Use 'none' if there is no heating system or if there is a heat pump serving a heating load.

choice.value: Shared Boiler w/ Ductless Fan Coil
choice.display_name: Shared Boiler w/ Ductless Fan Coil

argument.name: heating_system_fuel
argument.description: The fuel type of the heating system. Ignored for ElectricResistance.

argument.name: heating_system_heating_efficiency
argument.display_name: Heating System: Rated AFUE or Percent
argument.description: The rated heating efficiency value of the heating system.

argument.name: heating_system_heating_capacity
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the heating system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default is used.

argument.name: heating_system_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Heating System: Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The heating load served by the heating system.

argument.name: heating_system_airflow_defect_ratio
argument.description: The airflow defect ratio, defined as (InstalledAirflow - DesignAirflow) / DesignAirflow, of the heating system per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no airflow defect. Applies only to Furnace. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: cooling_system_type
argument.description: The type of cooling system. Use 'none' if there is no cooling system or if there is a heat pump serving a cooling load.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of the cooling system. System types central air conditioner and mini-split use SEER or SEER2. System types room air conditioner and packaged terminal air conditioner use EER or CEER. Ignored for system type evaporative cooler.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_efficiency
argument.description: The rated efficiency value of the cooling system. Ignored for evaporative cooler.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_compressor_type
argument.description: The compressor type of the cooling system. Only applies to central air conditioner. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_sensible_heat_fraction
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Cooling Sensible Heat Fraction
argument.description: The sensible heat fraction of the cooling system. Ignored for evaporative cooler. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_capacity
argument.description: The output cooling capacity of the cooling system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default is used.

argument.name: cooling_system_fraction_cool_load_served
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Fraction Cool Load Served
argument.description: The cooling load served by the cooling system.

argument.name: cooling_system_is_ducted
argument.description: Whether the cooling system is ducted or not. Only used for mini-split and evaporative cooler. It's assumed that central air conditioner is ducted, and room air conditioner and packaged terminal air conditioner are not ducted.

argument.name: cooling_system_airflow_defect_ratio
argument.description: The airflow defect ratio, defined as (InstalledAirflow - DesignAirflow) / DesignAirflow, of the cooling system per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no airflow defect. Applies only to central air conditioner and ducted mini-split. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: cooling_system_charge_defect_ratio
argument.description: The refrigerant charge defect ratio, defined as (InstalledCharge - DesignCharge) / DesignCharge, of the cooling system per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no refrigerant charge defect. Applies only to central air conditioner and mini-split. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: cooling_system_integrated_heating_system_fuel
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Integrated Heating System Fuel Type
argument.description: The fuel type of the heating system integrated into cooling system. Only used for packaged terminal air conditioner and room air conditioner.

argument.name: cooling_system_integrated_heating_system_efficiency_percent
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Integrated Heating System Efficiency
argument.description: The rated heating efficiency value of the heating system integrated into cooling system. Only used for packaged terminal air conditioner and room air conditioner.

argument.name: cooling_system_integrated_heating_system_capacity
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Integrated Heating System Heating Capacity
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the heating system integrated into cooling system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default is used. Only used for packaged terminal air conditioner and room air conditioner.

argument.name: cooling_system_integrated_heating_system_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Integrated Heating System Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The heating load served by the heating system integrated into cooling system. Only used for packaged terminal air conditioner and room air conditioner.

argument.name: heat_pump_type
argument.description: The type of heat pump. Use 'none' if there is no heat pump.

choice.value: room air conditioner with reverse cycle
choice.display_name: room air conditioner with reverse cycle

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_efficiency_type
argument.description: The heating efficiency type of heat pump. System types air-to-air and mini-split use HSPF or HSPF2. System types ground-to-air, packaged terminal heat pump and room air conditioner with reverse cycle use COP.

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_efficiency
argument.description: The rated heating efficiency value of the heat pump.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_efficiency_type
argument.description: The cooling efficiency type of heat pump. System types air-to-air and mini-split use SEER or SEER2. System types ground-to-air, packaged terminal heat pump and room air conditioner with reverse cycle use EER.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_efficiency
argument.description: The rated cooling efficiency value of the heat pump.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_compressor_type
argument.description: The compressor type of the heat pump. Only applies to air-to-air. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_sensible_heat_fraction
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Cooling Sensible Heat Fraction
argument.description: The sensible heat fraction of the heat pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_capacity
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the heat pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_capacity_17_f
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the heat pump at 17F. Only applies to air-to-air and mini-split. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_capacity
argument.description: The output cooling capacity of the heat pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The heating load served by the heat pump.

argument.name: heat_pump_fraction_cool_load_served
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Fraction Cool Load Served
argument.description: The cooling load served by the heat pump.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_type
argument.description: The backup type of the heat pump. If 'integrated', represents e.g. built-in electric strip heat or dual-fuel integrated furnace. If 'separate', represents e.g. electric baseboard or boiler based on the Heating System 2 specified below. Use 'none' if there is no backup heating.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_fuel
argument.description: The backup fuel type of the heat pump. Only applies if Backup Type is 'integrated'.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_heating_efficiency
argument.description: The backup rated efficiency value of the heat pump. Percent for electricity fuel type. AFUE otherwise. Only applies if Backup Type is 'integrated'.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_heating_capacity
argument.description: The backup output heating capacity of the heat pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default is used. Only applies if Backup Type is 'integrated'.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_heating_switchover_temp
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Backup Heating Switchover Temperature
argument.description: The temperature at which the heat pump stops operating and the backup heating system starts running. Only applies to air-to-air and mini-split. If not provided, backup heating will operate as needed when heat pump capacity is insufficient. Applies if Backup Type is either 'integrated' or 'separate'. Both Switchover Temperature and Lockout Temperature cannot be specified.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_heating_lockout_temp
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Backup Heating Lockout Temperature
argument.description: The temperature above which the backup system is disabled in order to prevent backup heating operation during, e.g., a thermostat heating setback recovery event. If not provided, backup heating will operate as needed when heat pump capacity is insufficient. Only applies if Backup Type is 'integrated'. Both Switchover Temperature and Lockout Temperature cannot be specified.

argument.name: heat_pump_sizing_methodology
argument.description: The auto-sizing methodology to use when the heat pump capacity is not provided. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_is_ducted
argument.description: Whether the heat pump is ducted or not. Only used for mini-split. It's assumed that air-to-air and ground-to-air are ducted. If not provided, assumes not ducted.

argument.name: heat_pump_airflow_defect_ratio
argument.description: The airflow defect ratio, defined as (InstalledAirflow - DesignAirflow) / DesignAirflow, of the heat pump per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no airflow defect. Applies only to air-to-air, ducted mini-split, and ground-to-air. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: heat_pump_charge_defect_ratio
argument.description: The refrigerant charge defect ratio, defined as (InstalledCharge - DesignCharge) / DesignCharge, of the heat pump per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no refrigerant charge defect. Applies to all heat pump types. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: heating_system_2_type
argument.description: The type of the second heating system.

argument.name: heating_system_2_fuel
argument.description: The fuel type of the second heating system. Ignored for ElectricResistance.

argument.name: heating_system_2_heating_efficiency
argument.display_name: Heating System 2: Rated AFUE or Percent
argument.description: The rated heating efficiency value of the second heating system.

argument.name: heating_system_2_heating_capacity
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the second heating system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default is used.

argument.name: heating_system_2_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Heating System 2: Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The heat load served fraction of the second heating system. Ignored if this heating system serves as a backup system for a heat pump.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Heating Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday heating setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekend_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Heating Weekend Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekend heating setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday cooling setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekend_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekend Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekend cooling setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date like 'Nov 1 - Jun 30'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used. Can also provide 'BuildingAmerica' to use automatic seasons from the Building America House Simulation Protocols.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date like 'Jun 1 - Oct 31'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used. Can also provide 'BuildingAmerica' to use automatic seasons from the Building America House Simulation Protocols.

argument.name: ducts_leakage_units
argument.description: The leakage units of the ducts.

argument.name: ducts_supply_leakage_to_outside_value
argument.display_name: Ducts: Supply Leakage to Outside Value
argument.description: The leakage value to outside for the supply ducts.

argument.name: ducts_return_leakage_to_outside_value
argument.display_name: Ducts: Return Leakage to Outside Value
argument.description: The leakage value to outside for the return ducts.

argument.name: ducts_supply_location
argument.description: The location of the supply ducts. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: ducts_supply_insulation_r
argument.description: The insulation r-value of the supply ducts excluding air films.

argument.name: ducts_supply_surface_area
argument.description: The surface area of the supply ducts. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: ducts_return_location
argument.description: The location of the return ducts. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: ducts_return_insulation_r
argument.description: The insulation r-value of the return ducts excluding air films.

argument.name: ducts_return_surface_area
argument.description: The surface area of the return ducts. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: ducts_number_of_return_registers
argument.description: The number of return registers of the ducts. Only used to calculate default return duct surface area. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: mech_vent_fan_type
argument.description: The type of the mechanical ventilation. Use 'none' if there is no mechanical ventilation system.

argument.name: mech_vent_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the mechanical ventilation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: mech_vent_hours_in_operation
argument.description: The hours in operation of the mechanical ventilation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: mech_vent_recovery_efficiency_type
argument.display_name: Mechanical Ventilation: Total Recovery Efficiency Type
argument.description: The total recovery efficiency type of the mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: mech_vent_total_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: The Unadjusted or Adjusted total recovery efficiency of the mechanical ventilation. Applies to energy recovery ventilator.

argument.name: mech_vent_sensible_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: The Unadjusted or Adjusted sensible recovery efficiency of the mechanical ventilation. Applies to energy recovery ventilator and heat recovery ventilator.

argument.name: mech_vent_fan_power
argument.description: The fan power of the mechanical ventilation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: mech_vent_num_units_served
argument.display_name: Mechanical Ventilation: Number of Units Served
argument.description: Number of dwelling units served by the mechanical ventilation system. Must be 1 if single-family detached. Used to apportion flow rate and fan power to the unit.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_frac_recirculation
argument.description: Fraction of the total supply air that is recirculated, with the remainder assumed to be outdoor air. The value must be 0 for exhaust only systems. Required for a shared mechanical ventilation system.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_preheating_fuel
argument.description: Fuel type of the preconditioning heating equipment. Only used for a shared mechanical ventilation system. If not provided, assumes no preheating.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_preheating_efficiency
argument.description: Efficiency of the preconditioning heating equipment. Only used for a shared mechanical ventilation system. If not provided, assumes no preheating.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_preheating_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Shared Mechanical Ventilation: Preheating Fraction Ventilation Heat Load Served
argument.description: Fraction of heating load introduced by the shared ventilation system that is met by the preconditioning heating equipment. If not provided, assumes no preheating.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_precooling_fuel
argument.description: Fuel type of the preconditioning cooling equipment. Only used for a shared mechanical ventilation system. If not provided, assumes no precooling.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_precooling_efficiency
argument.description: Efficiency of the preconditioning cooling equipment. Only used for a shared mechanical ventilation system. If not provided, assumes no precooling.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_precooling_fraction_cool_load_served
argument.display_name: Shared Mechanical Ventilation: Precooling Fraction Ventilation Cool Load Served
argument.description: Fraction of cooling load introduced by the shared ventilation system that is met by the preconditioning cooling equipment. If not provided, assumes no precooling.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_fan_type
argument.description: The type of the second mechanical ventilation. Use 'none' if there is no second mechanical ventilation system.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the second mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_hours_in_operation
argument.description: The hours in operation of the second mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_recovery_efficiency_type
argument.display_name: Mechanical Ventilation 2: Total Recovery Efficiency Type
argument.description: The total recovery efficiency type of the second mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_total_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: The Unadjusted or Adjusted total recovery efficiency of the second mechanical ventilation. Applies to energy recovery ventilator.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_sensible_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: The Unadjusted or Adjusted sensible recovery efficiency of the second mechanical ventilation. Applies to energy recovery ventilator and heat recovery ventilator.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_fan_power
argument.description: The fan power of the second mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_quantity
argument.description: The quantity of the kitchen fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the kitchen fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_hours_in_operation
argument.description: The hours in operation of the kitchen fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_power
argument.description: The fan power of the kitchen fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_start_hour
argument.description: The start hour of the kitchen fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_quantity
argument.description: The quantity of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_hours_in_operation
argument.description: The hours in operation of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_power
argument.description: The fan power of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_start_hour
argument.description: The start hour of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: whole_house_fan_present
argument.description: Whether there is a whole house fan.

argument.name: whole_house_fan_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the whole house fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: whole_house_fan_power
argument.description: The fan power of the whole house fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: water_heater_type
argument.description: The type of water heater. Use 'none' if there is no water heater.

argument.name: water_heater_fuel_type
argument.description: The fuel type of water heater. Ignored for heat pump water heater.

argument.name: water_heater_location
argument.description: The location of water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: water_heater_tank_volume
argument.description: Nominal volume of water heater tank. Only applies to storage water heater, heat pump water heater, and space-heating boiler with storage tank. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: water_heater_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of water heater. Does not apply to space-heating boilers.

argument.name: water_heater_efficiency
argument.description: Rated Energy Factor or Uniform Energy Factor. Does not apply to space-heating boilers.

argument.name: water_heater_usage_bin
argument.description: The usage of the water heater. Only applies if Efficiency Type is UniformEnergyFactor and Type is not instantaneous water heater. Does not apply to space-heating boilers. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: water_heater_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: Ratio of energy delivered to water heater to the energy content of the fuel consumed by the water heater. Only used for non-electric storage water heaters. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: water_heater_heating_capacity
argument.description: Heating capacity. Only applies to storage water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: water_heater_standby_loss
argument.description: The standby loss of water heater. Only applies to space-heating boilers. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: water_heater_jacket_rvalue
argument.description: The jacket R-value of water heater. Doesn't apply to instantaneous water heater or space-heating boiler with tankless coil. If not provided, defaults to no jacket insulation.

argument.name: water_heater_setpoint_temperature
argument.description: The setpoint temperature of water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: water_heater_num_units_served
argument.display_name: Water Heater: Number of Units Served
argument.description: Number of dwelling units served (directly or indirectly) by the water heater. Must be 1 if single-family detached. Used to apportion water heater tank losses to the unit.

argument.name: water_heater_uses_desuperheater
argument.description: Requires that the dwelling unit has a air-to-air, mini-split, or ground-to-air heat pump or a central air conditioner or mini-split air conditioner. If not provided, assumes no desuperheater.

argument.name: water_heater_tank_model_type
argument.description: Type of tank model to use. The 'stratified' tank generally provide more accurate results, but may significantly increase run time. Applies only to storage water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: water_heater_operating_mode
argument.description: The water heater operating mode. The 'heat pump only' option only uses the heat pump, while 'standard' allows the backup electric resistance to come on in high demand situations. This is ignored if a scheduled operating mode type is selected. Applies only to heat pump water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_system_type
argument.description: The type of the hot water distribution system.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_standard_piping_length
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Standard Piping Length
argument.description: If the distribution system is Standard, the length of the piping. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_recirc_control_type
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Recirculation Control Type
argument.description: If the distribution system is Recirculation, the type of hot water recirculation control, if any.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_recirc_piping_length
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Recirculation Piping Length
argument.description: If the distribution system is Recirculation, the length of the recirculation piping. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_recirc_branch_piping_length
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Recirculation Branch Piping Length
argument.description: If the distribution system is Recirculation, the length of the recirculation branch piping. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_recirc_pump_power
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Recirculation Pump Power
argument.description: If the distribution system is Recirculation, the recirculation pump power. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_pipe_r
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Pipe Insulation Nominal R-Value
argument.description: Nominal R-value of the pipe insulation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dwhr_facilities_connected
argument.display_name: Drain Water Heat Recovery: Facilities Connected
argument.description: Which facilities are connected for the drain water heat recovery. Use 'none' if there is no drain water heat recovery system.

argument.name: dwhr_equal_flow
argument.display_name: Drain Water Heat Recovery: Equal Flow
argument.description: Whether the drain water heat recovery has equal flow.

argument.name: dwhr_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the drain water heat recovery.

argument.name: water_fixtures_shower_low_flow
argument.display_name: Hot Water Fixtures: Is Shower Low Flow
argument.description: Whether the shower fixture is low flow.

argument.name: water_fixtures_sink_low_flow
argument.display_name: Hot Water Fixtures: Is Sink Low Flow
argument.description: Whether the sink fixture is low flow.

argument.name: water_fixtures_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the hot water usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: solar_thermal_system_type
argument.description: The type of solar thermal system. Use 'none' if there is no solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_area
argument.description: The collector area of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_loop_type
argument.description: The collector loop type of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_type
argument.description: The collector type of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_azimuth
argument.description: The collector azimuth of the solar thermal system. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_tilt
argument.description: The collector tilt of the solar thermal system. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_rated_optical_efficiency
argument.display_name: Solar Thermal: Collector Rated Optical Efficiency
argument.description: The collector rated optical efficiency of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_rated_thermal_losses
argument.display_name: Solar Thermal: Collector Rated Thermal Losses
argument.description: The collector rated thermal losses of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_storage_volume
argument.description: The storage volume of the solar thermal system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: solar_thermal_solar_fraction
argument.description: The solar fraction of the solar thermal system. If provided, overrides all other solar thermal inputs.

argument.name: pv_system_present
argument.description: Whether there is a PV system present.

argument.name: pv_system_module_type
argument.description: Module type of the PV system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: pv_system_location
argument.description: Location of the PV system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: pv_system_tracking
argument.description: Type of tracking for the PV system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: pv_system_array_azimuth
argument.description: Array azimuth of the PV system. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: pv_system_array_tilt
argument.description: Array tilt of the PV system. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: pv_system_max_power_output
argument.description: Maximum power output of the PV system. For a shared system, this is the total building maximum power output.

argument.name: pv_system_inverter_efficiency
argument.description: Inverter efficiency of the PV system. If there are two PV systems, this will apply to both. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: pv_system_system_losses_fraction
argument.description: System losses fraction of the PV system. If there are two PV systems, this will apply to both. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: pv_system_num_bedrooms_served
argument.display_name: PV System: Number of Bedrooms Served
argument.description: Number of bedrooms served by PV system. Required if single-family attached or apartment unit. Used to apportion PV generation to the unit of a SFA/MF building. If there are two PV systems, this will apply to both.

argument.name: pv_system_2_present
argument.description: Whether there is a second PV system present.

argument.name: pv_system_2_module_type
argument.description: Module type of the second PV system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: pv_system_2_location
argument.description: Location of the second PV system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: pv_system_2_tracking
argument.description: Type of tracking for the second PV system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: pv_system_2_array_azimuth
argument.description: Array azimuth of the second PV system. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: pv_system_2_array_tilt
argument.description: Array tilt of the second PV system. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: pv_system_2_max_power_output
argument.description: Maximum power output of the second PV system. For a shared system, this is the total building maximum power output.

argument.name: battery_present
argument.description: Whether there is a lithium ion battery present.

argument.name: battery_location
argument.description: The space type for the lithium ion battery location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: battery_power
argument.description: The rated power output of the lithium ion battery. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: battery_capacity
argument.description: The nominal capacity of the lithium ion battery. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: battery_usable_capacity
argument.description: The usable capacity of the lithium ion battery. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: battery_round_trip_efficiency
argument.description: The round trip efficiency of the lithium ion battery. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: lighting_present
argument.description: Whether there is lighting energy use.

argument.name: lighting_interior_fraction_cfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (interior) that are compact fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_interior_fraction_lfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (interior) that are linear fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_interior_fraction_led
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (interior) that are light emitting diodes. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_interior_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the lighting energy usage (interior) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: lighting_exterior_fraction_cfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (exterior) that are compact fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_exterior_fraction_lfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (exterior) that are linear fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_exterior_fraction_led
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (exterior) that are light emitting diodes. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_exterior_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the lighting energy usage (exterior) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: lighting_garage_fraction_cfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (garage) that are compact fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_garage_fraction_lfl
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (garage) that are linear fluorescent. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_garage_fraction_led
argument.description: Fraction of all lamps (garage) that are light emitting diodes. Lighting not specified as CFL, LFL, or LED is assumed to be incandescent.

argument.name: lighting_garage_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the lighting energy usage (garage) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: holiday_lighting_present
argument.description: Whether there is holiday lighting.

argument.name: holiday_lighting_daily_kwh
argument.description: The daily energy consumption for holiday lighting (exterior). If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: holiday_lighting_period
argument.description: Enter a date like "Nov 25 - Jan 5". If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dehumidifier_type
argument.description: The type of dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_capacity
argument.description: The capacity (water removal rate) of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_rh_setpoint
argument.description: The relative humidity setpoint of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: dehumidifier_fraction_dehumidification_load_served
argument.description: The dehumidification load served fraction of the dehumidifier.

argument.name: clothes_washer_present
argument.description: Whether there is a clothes washer present.

argument.name: clothes_washer_location
argument.description: The space type for the clothes washer location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of the clothes washer.

argument.name: clothes_washer_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the clothes washer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_rated_annual_kwh
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_electric_rate
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_gas_rate
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_annual_gas_cost
argument.display_name: Clothes Washer: Label Annual Cost with Gas DHW
argument.description: The annual cost of using the system under test conditions. Input is obtained from the EnergyGuide label. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_label_usage
argument.description: The clothes washer loads per week. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_capacity
argument.description: Volume of the washer drum. Obtained from the EnergyStar website or the manufacturer's literature. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_washer_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the clothes washer energy and hot water usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_present
argument.description: Whether there is a clothes dryer present.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_location
argument.description: The space type for the clothes dryer location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_fuel_type
argument.description: Type of fuel used by the clothes dryer.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of the clothes dryer.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the clothes dryer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_vented_flow_rate
argument.description: The exhaust flow rate of the vented clothes dryer. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: clothes_dryer_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the clothes dryer energy usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_present
argument.description: Whether there is a dishwasher present.

argument.name: dishwasher_location
argument.description: The space type for the dishwasher location. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of dishwasher.

argument.name: dishwasher_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_electric_rate
argument.description: The label electric rate of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_gas_rate
argument.description: The label gas rate of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_annual_gas_cost
argument.description: The label annual gas cost of the dishwasher. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_label_usage
argument.description: The dishwasher loads per week. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_place_setting_capacity
argument.description: The number of place settings for the unit. Data obtained from manufacturer's literature. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: dishwasher_usage_multiplier

argument.description: Total number of ceiling fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: ceiling_fan_cooling_setpoint_temp_offset
argument.display_name: Ceiling Fan: Cooling Setpoint Temperature Offset
argument.description: The setpoint temperature offset during cooling season for the ceiling fan(s). Only applies if ceiling fan quantity is greater than zero. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default is used.

argument.name: emissions_scenario_names
argument.description: Names of emissions scenarios. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, no emissions scenarios are calculated.

argument.name: emissions_types
argument.description: Types of emissions (e.g., CO2e, NOx, etc.). If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_units
argument.description: Electricity emissions factors units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. Only lb/MWh and kg/MWh are allowed.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_values_or_filepaths
argument.display_name: Emissions: Electricity Values or File Paths
argument.description: Electricity emissions factors values, specified as either an annual factor or an absolute/relative path to a file with hourly factors. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_number_of_header_rows
argument.display_name: Emissions: Electricity Files Number of Header Rows
argument.description: The number of header rows in the electricity emissions factor file. Only applies when an electricity filepath is used. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_electricity_column_numbers
argument.description: The column number in the electricity emissions factor file. Only applies when an electricity filepath is used. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_fossil_fuel_units
argument.description: Fossil fuel emissions factors units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. Only lb/MBtu and kg/MBtu are allowed.

argument.name: emissions_natural_gas_values
argument.description: Natural gas emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_propane_values
argument.description: Propane emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_fuel_oil_values
argument.description: Fuel oil emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_coal_values
argument.description: Coal emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_wood_values
argument.description: Wood emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: emissions_wood_pellets_values
argument.description: Wood pellets emissions factors values, specified as an annual factor. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_scenario_names
argument.description: Names of utility bill scenarios. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, no utility bills scenarios are calculated.

argument.name: utility_bill_electricity_filepaths
argument.description: Electricity tariff file specified as an absolute/relative path to a file with utility rate structure information. Tariff file must be formatted to OpenEI API version 7. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_electricity_fixed_charges
argument.description: Electricity utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_natural_gas_fixed_charges
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Natural Gas Fixed Charges
argument.description: Natural gas utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_propane_fixed_charges
argument.description: Propane utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_fuel_oil_fixed_charges
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Fuel Oil Fixed Charges
argument.description: Fuel oil utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_coal_fixed_charges
argument.description: Coal utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_fixed_charges
argument.description: Wood utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_pellets_fixed_charges
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Wood Pellets Fixed Charges
argument.description: Wood pellets utility bill monthly fixed charges. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_electricity_marginal_rates
argument.description: Electricity utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_natural_gas_marginal_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Natural Gas Marginal Rates
argument.description: Natural gas utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_propane_marginal_rates
argument.description: Propane utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_fuel_oil_marginal_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Fuel Oil Marginal Rates
argument.description: Fuel oil utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_coal_marginal_rates
argument.description: Coal utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_marginal_rates
argument.description: Wood utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_wood_pellets_marginal_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: Wood Pellets Marginal Rates
argument.description: Wood pellets utility bill marginal rates. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_compensation_types
argument.description: Utility bill PV compensation types. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_net_metering_annual_excess_sellback_rate_types
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Net Metering Annual Excess Sellback Rate Types
argument.description: Utility bill PV net metering annual excess sellback rate types. Only applies if the PV compensation type is 'NetMetering'. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_net_metering_annual_excess_sellback_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Net Metering Annual Excess Sellback Rates
argument.description: Utility bill PV net metering annual excess sellback rates. Only applies if the PV compensation type is 'NetMetering' and the PV annual excess sellback rate type is 'User-Specified'. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_feed_in_tariff_rates
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Feed-In Tariff Rates
argument.description: Utility bill PV annual full/gross feed-in tariff rates. Only applies if the PV compensation type is 'FeedInTariff'. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_monthly_grid_connection_fee_units
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Monthly Grid Connection Fee Units
argument.description: Utility bill PV monthly grid connection fee units. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: utility_bill_pv_monthly_grid_connection_fees
argument.display_name: Utility Bills: PV Monthly Grid Connection Fees
argument.description: Utility bill PV monthly grid connection fees. If multiple scenarios, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: additional_properties
argument.description: Additional properties specified as key-value pairs (i.e., key=value). If multiple additional properties, use a |-separated list. For example, 'LowIncome=false|Remodeled|Description=2-story home in Denver'. These properties will be stored in the HPXML file under /HPXML/SoftwareInfo/extension/AdditionalProperties.

argument.name: apply_defaults
argument.description: If true, applies OS-HPXML default values to the HPXML output file.

argument.name: apply_validation
argument.description: If true, validates the HPXML output file. Set to false for faster performance. Note that validation is not needed if the HPXML file will be validated downstream (e.g., via the HPXMLtoOpenStudio measure).
